subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
msgSnippet: Scott, I think you re going to have to give us a little more to go on here :-).  What JDK are you using, what runtime?  What version of JUnit?  What does the
messageBody:
Scott,

I think you're going to have to give us a little more to go on
here :-). What JDK are you using, what runtime? What version
of JUnit? What does the command line that you invoke when you
get the error look like? What are the values of environment
variables (e.g., CLASSPATH)?

Have you tried a minimal test case, does it still give the
error? Something like

// package, import, etc.
public class MinimalTest extends TestCase {
// constructor, suite(), etc.
public void testAlwaysPass() {
assertTrue(true);
}
}

-- Andrew

-----Original Message-----
From: Clemmons, Scott [mailto:scott.clemmons@...]
Sent: 12 July 2001 14:17
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources


As an update, I unchecked the Reload classes every run in the GUI
TestRunners and now I get the same Missing Resources error that I'm getting
with the non-gui version.
-Scott
